reviews.text: wow
Only saw the island from a boat.
Restricted Island
Do your bit for the environment
My house. Fishing home ground

result.formatted_address: Wong Nai Chung Reservoir, Tai Tam, Hong Kong
result.name: Wong Nai Chung Reservoir

reviews.text:
The Wong Nai Chung Reservoir was the third man made lake constructed in Hong Kong back in 1889 and can be found just off the Wong Nai Chung Gap Road on Hong Kong Island. It is a small reservoir only holding around 27 million gallons, which led to the further damming of the nearby Tai Tam Valley to create a series of additional lakes in the decades that followed its construction.

There is a small park that opened to the public in 1986 immediately around the lake which includes a recreation centre where you can hire leisure boats to enjoy on the lake (closed presently due to the pandemic). There is a kiosk for refreshments and public toilets as well. Another point of interest are the four Declared Monuments that can be viewed at Wong Nai Chung Reservoir. These include the reservoir dam, weir, value house and workman's quarters building just west of the lake.

In the end, a visit to the Wong Nai Chung Reservoir and Park is best combined with a visit to the much larger and interesting series of reservoirs, trails and declared monuments that make up the Tai Tam Heritage Trail in the Tai Tam Country Park to the east of here. You can visit Wong Nai Chung first at the start of the hike and day in the country park before proceeding east on foot to Tai Tam.

Note: From the city, take bus 6 between Central and Stanley. Exit at Wong Nai Chung Gap Road which you will see on the announcement sign in the bus. The exit is at a Sinopec petrol station. Walk up a small staircase to the Tai Tam Reservoir Road and walk to your left 150 metres or so and you will arrive at the Wong Nai Chung Reservoir Park. There are signs along the way and onward to the Tai Tam Reservoirs, Country Park and Heritage Trail as well.

The construction of the Wong Nai Chung Reservoir (黃泥涌水塘) was completed in 1899 at the cost of $8,200, with a storage capacity of 27 million gallons – 38% of that of Pokfulam Reservoir. It was the third reservoir built in Hong Kong.

As other larger reservoirs were constructed, the Wong Nai Chung Reservoir gradually became superfluous, and in 1982 it was converted into Wong Nai Chung Reservoir Park – a country park with boating, fishing and other recreational facilities like picnic and barbecue areas, refreshment kiosks and children’s play areas.

There are four structures at the reservoir which are considered to have historical and architectural merit. They are the Dam, the Valve House, the Weir and the Workmen’s Quarters now still used by WSD.
You can start/end here on the way hiking to Violet Hill
Apart from the public toilets and a few vending machines, all other services are suspended
A nice place

result.formatted_address: 11 Tai Tong Shan Rd, Yuen Long, Hong Kong
result.name: Tai Tong Organic EcoPark

reviews.text:
Kids enjoy it but from a educational, ecological and financial point of view it is a disaster start to finish.

There is nothing organic or ecological there with the exception of plenty of mosquitoes. Massive use of plastic, single use items starting from the feeding trays to the artificial green grass used as an outdoor sliding area.

The state of the animal farm is sad and reflects a 1950 understanding of animal welfare. The all concrete and metal enclaves for most animals with little space and greenery makes is a case for how not to treat animals. In most developed nations this would have been closed down long time ago.

Financially it is squeezing out money at every attraction. So make sure you either buy a few tickets at the park entrance (and they come in bulk of four tickets but it’s a better deal than buying it one by one inside the park) or just stroll through and try resist your kids forcing you to buy attraction tickets.

The overall state of the park is frankly speaking bad. The seating areas are dirty, chairs broken, toilets small and smelly, no soap or hand towels in the bathrooms, the playground worn out, trash almost everywhere…

I had fun, the food at the restaurant is great, their soy sauce chicken is a bomb! Lot of things to do especially with the kids, there are different kinds of animals that you can feed, but you have to buy ticket for Thier food, the entrance fee is 80dollars adult.

It's good for kids with some live animals like pig, horse, goat, rabbits, guinea pigs and birds like peacock, white and regular ones, pea hens,  fowl, turkey etc. However the animal enclosures are very smelly due to their urine and poop in enclosures .
The main or star activity for kids is the horse ride which is good👍 . Those horses are quite well maintained and don't smell. Bouncy castle, family bi cycling, funny climbing net is also good and kids enjoy a lot. At least 3  to 4 hours is needed inside the park excluding travel time.
Lotus pond is amazing with fish feeding activity for all.

What a dump! Dirty and rude staff. So many hazard risks in kids play area, very unsafe. Animals don’t appear to be in the best of health. Once you pay the entrance fee you need to pay for everything inside. Most attractions require a few tickets per child so it ends up being a very expensive day for such a disappointing venue. They have limited food options and all low quality. Hot food was served cold. Rubbish everywhere and staff don’t seem to care. They yell and have no manners. It’s simply a money making business with no regard for the environment. Single use plastic cups are used for animal feed and it was sad to see them thrown around the place. Don’t understand how they are still open for business. Nothing eco friendly about this farm.

A large park. You pay an entry fee and you get some coupons which you can use for activities. Apart from the playgrounds anything needs to be paid / needs coupons. There are some nice kids activities like carts or sliding down the hill, house ride (2 coupons for 30sec in a circle!), etc.
Note, there are quite some insects, the small ones you almost don't see, but which bite. So, don't forget insect spray even it might help completely.
Some food can be purchased inside the park, but you can also bring your own food.

result.formatted_address: Victoria Rd, Mount Davis, Hong Kong
result.name: Sai Wan Swimming Shed

reviews.text: Nice sunset view & cool environment. With 2/3 houses of fisher men who enjoy swimming there. Note when you go during summer time always remember to take insect repellent & long sleeves clothes.
Prepare for a mini sweat walk from the station and up the slopes and down the stairs. Nice chill spot. Great for a late afternoon visit.
Low key touristic place but very well hidden and not many people go here. The local amenities are a cute sight as well as the swimming area itself (currently locked off). Lots to discover.
a quiet and tranquil swimming spot at the edge of Hong Kong island, however people need to consider their own swimming ability and saftey before going down for a swim

Very cool place to get in the water ... Note the boat traffic doesn't really allow open water swimming here .
I run all the way from Sheung Wan .
It's a serious climb in the end . Note steps are slippery up and down.

result.formatted_address: Mount Austin Rd, The Peak, Hong Kong
result.name: Victoria Peak Garden

reviews.text: If you can make it to the top to this garden then you'd be greeted with rewarding views.  I think without a car I would not have reached this peak garden, certainly didn't even know about it in the past when I was a normal tourist on foot.  Today it was cloudy at the peak and probably for the first time I stood in the clouds as it swept past me.  Well worth the struggle up to if you can make it.

It s 20min walk to go up (but not fast walking).
You will find quite a small garden however the view is amazing there.
There is not too much people.

The Victoria peak garden can be directly accessible by car (there is a parking)

It’s not HK
Very peaceful and nice
The washroom is like a smaller villa
I’m sure this the khs most expensive washroom 🤪

Prepare yourself for a long line during night visit.

Best view at night
Make sure to be there before 8 to witness symphony of light
Awesome place to view the city from. Beautiful mountains with skyscrapers in the background! Also felt very safe at night

Interesting rocks, nice view!!!
Indeed, wonders of nature are amazing!
Be careful and be aware of the path, there are tombs everywhere but cannot notice easily. Better to give respect than to disregard it.
Beautiful place..

Definitely one of the most beautiful hiking area in town which is accessible and can be finished quickly (though not easy level with the steep hillside)
The view here is just astonishing
It's a good place for hike and climbing too, first we have to descend from mount Johnston to go to Ap lei Pai. Don't forget bring the gloves.

A great place for hikers and lovers of nature.. if you like coastal hiking on rocks,  i love to tell you try this place... wonderful! But please prepare hand gloves coz you are climbing on rocks... 🏔🏞⛰💪🙏👌💕
Short Climbing  hikes wz excellent scenaries of coastlines and  buildings on other side. beautiful lighthouse. 💖💖💖

Love this place....🥰
But  swimming not allowed...in this area...

Beautiful hike from Hong Kong trail 4 to 5. The waterfall is a fantastic place to have a picnic and there is a large pool where you can cool off. You are at the top of the fall and you can't see the water falling down but there is a constant stream of water rushing down creating little pools of water. I decided to take off my socks and shoes and dunked them into one of the said pools. Iwas bliss. What was missing was a cool bottle of beer. Water was not too hot or too cold but at the perfect temperature. No need for a towel as the sun dried off my feet in minutes.

As I was leaving another 2 groups came along and it looked like they were going to take a well deserved dip into the main big pool as they began to strip off. See pic.

Need to remember to bring a couple of cans for next time.

This is a busy route as there is gorgeous reservoirs with large koi carp in and one with a fountain. So getting back can be a pain as the bus is only every 30 mins and it's packed.

Beautiful waterfall, though you're not allowed to swim in the pool directly below the waterfall itself (two workmen appeared while I was there to chase people out who were swimming there).

I don't know why you're not allowed to swim in that part because about 30 metres down steam there is another, smaller and less deep pool you are allowed to swim in!

You can also relax on the rocks directly above the waterfall. Overall this is a nice place for a picnic. I didn't see any mosquitoes and the trees provide welcome shade from the sun. And it's only a 20 minute walk from the bus stop!

Everything you need is to seach in google if you want to find this place or ask the local how to get here bcs the falls beauty is hiding ..not recommended for children under 8y/o(my own opinion)bcs the way down to the falls is rocky,and slippery (small sharp rocks) so be carefull when you want to there ..
Nice hidden tiny waterfall, but PLEASE DO NOT SWIM THERE. The water flows into the Tai Tam Reservoir.

Po Pin Chau is formed by hexagonal volcano stone. To me I only saw similar formation in Iceland.

Starting the walk from the blue memorial stone at the East dam of High Island Reservoir to Po Pin Chau, you can see a very beautiful scenery of the Reservoir construction as well as the open sea view.

Take a green taxi from Sai Kung town center. You arrive at the East dam about 20 to 25 minutes. Along the road, you may see a large number of cows walking slowly or maybe they will block your way temporarily.

The taxi fare is about $140. You may choose 4 seat or 5 seat taxi dependent on the number of passengers. To ease your coming back, it is better to ask for the telephone number of the taxi call center.

You may take photos at the blue memorial stone and go to wash room before starting the trail. Not far away from the toilet booth, you may see the starting point, a stairs, to Po Pin Chau. Counting on taking photos along the trail, you may spend about 1 or 1.5 hours to Po Pin Chau.

Upon return, you will go to the end of the Dam and wait for a taxi. When arriving at Sai Kung town center, do not forget to try seafood.

It is really not a difficult walk to get to Po Pin Chau. Bring your walking stick and the steps are relatively well maintained.  A great way to enjoy the surrounding.

Make sure you bring enough water as there is no supplies here.
Amazing views and stunning rock formation ❤❤❤🥰
Nice nature landscape. Non experience  hikers neglect of risk to climb.

amazing rock formation...
nice for viewing but to get there is hard to step...up & down on the mountain

Fascinating little Island has a lot going for it.

Based in a Marine Park, the Island is also a UNESCO Geo Park (cool rocks to be found) and is the most North Eastern area of Hong Kong.

The water is clear with quite a few nice swimming spots to be found. Just remember to take your trash with you as the few people living on the Island would certainly appreciate it.

Hiking around the Island is more like a stroll and it's actually an extension of the Plover Cove Country Park for those keeping track.

Worth a visit to see a remote and almost forgotten Island of HK.

Wonderful little island part of HK.

To get there, I recommend being at the ferry pier at least 30m before departure as the queue can be very long. At the end of the queue, you will be able to buy toundtrip tickets for Tung Ping Chau. Don't worry if the queue seems long, in case there is a lot of people queuing the ferry company will send multiple boats.

Once on the island, there is pretty much nothing to buy, so come prepared with water and food. There are some spots (right of the arrival pier) where you can have a swim without rocks, so bring your swimsuit :)

The Tung Ping Chau trail is around 6.5 km in distance and circles the outlying island of Tung Ping Chau. It is a fairly easy hike which is a mix of paved walkway and quick a bit of natural trail. It takes around 3-4 hours to complete with minimal stops or up to 5-6 hours if you take in the numerous geological points of interest and viewpoints along the route. Plenty of signs, maps and highlight information panels found throughout the trail.

Note: There is a shorter version of the trail that skips the far north of the island cutting across the island at Cham Keng Chau on the west coast back across to the main ferry pier.

Note: To make your way to Tung Ping Chau for this particular hike, you will need to visit on the weekend and take the ferry from Ma Liu Shui Pier, 10 minute walk from University MTR Station. Sailings on only on Saturday (9am and 3pm) and Sunday (9am) and is around 1.5 hours to travel the 27km distance to Tung Ping Chau. The ferry returns from Tung Ping Chau to Ma Liu Shui Pier at 5.15pm (Sat and Sun). There are no daily sailings to Tung Ping Chau during weekdays.

The Tung Ping Chau Trail passes through several abandoned villages with ruinous hamlets and a handful of highlight geological sites where you can view, walk upon and admire unique sedimentary rock formations that protrude from the Earth at various angles and form beautiful coastal scenes alongside the clean blue waters that surround the island. There are nice beachfronts, stretches of hillside with heavy vegetation, wooded areas and even patches of bamboo forrest that you will see.

Particular highlights along the Tung Ping Chau Trail include A Ma Wan Beach, the Tin Hau Temple and Kang Lau Shek where you see impressive sea stacks and Wave-cut sedimentary patterns. Lung Lok Shui, Pak Lap Wan and Chau Wei Kok have similar wave-cut patterns and rock formations. There is a neat sea abrasion canyon you can walk through at Cam Keng Chau as well.

There are picnic areas and several public toilet facilities situated on the east side of the island trail. A small village area just a few hundred metres from the main pier includes a couple of island cafes where you will also find toilets. This is a good location for a rest break and bite to eat if you fancy something while waiting for the 5.15pm afternoon ferry off of Tung Ping Chau.

Overall, this trail offers a great full day out of the city, particularly when the weather is clear and favourable. The hike is quite easy and the scenery is very rewarding. There are a surprising number of other hikers and day trippers that you will see throughout the day but they tend to spread around the island so it isn't too difficult to find quiet spots if you look for them. The biggest issue with this particular trail is that it is limited to weekend use due to the lack of weekday ferries out to Tung Ping Chau.

Quite remote from HK, but definitely worth it! The island has amazing geological features, super cool to see and unique in HK due to its remote location. A good idea is to walk around the island, in 2 or 3 hours.

Fantastic forgotten island of Hong Kong. Once 3000 people lived here and now down to 10 or so. The ferry goes from Ma Lui Shui pier, get there early because it’s busy. We got there 30 mins early and only just got on the first boat. Once there, there are a few eating places open at weekends, the whole island takes 3-4 hours taking it very slowly and exploring the empty houses and villages. Well worth checking out the houses. Some very pretty beaches and outstanding geological features. Would be fun to camp out a night here.
It's fun to go see the caves.
Love the views around...
Pineapple Mountain (Por Lo Shan) never failed to amaze me with its incredible scenery and its colour is like a similarity to pineapple fruit 🍍.
The Chinese name of this place，菠蘿山，Por Lo Shan, means Pineapple Mountain.  It is on the west of Tuen Mun and is a popular hiking area with several miles of hiking trails.
I have no Idea what happened, I followed the directions and it took me to a cemetery… Now I’m a white guy disturbing the peace of people’s mourning. Fix it please. Thats just horrible
One of the mini mountain which located at the Tuen Mun city. Good for hiking even with kids.

Tai Mo Shan is the highest peak in Hong Kong, and it offers a truly remarkable experience for nature lovers and outdoor enthusiasts. I recently had the opportunity to visit Tai Mo Shan, and I was blown away by its beauty and tranquility.

The journey to Tai Mo Shan was an adventure in itself. The winding roads and lush greenery along the way created a sense of anticipation and excitement. Upon reaching the peak, I was greeted with breathtaking panoramic views of the surrounding landscape. The sight of rolling hills, dense forests, and the city skyline in the distance was simply awe-inspiring.

Another notable feature of Tai Mo Shan is its unique ecosystem. The mountain is home to a diverse range of flora and fauna, including rare species of plants and animals. It was a delight to spot colorful butterflies, hear the melodious songs of birds, and witness the vibrant blooms of wildflowers along the trails.

Overall, my visit to Tai Mo Shan was a truly memorable experience. The stunning views, peaceful atmosphere, and well-maintained facilities make it a must-visit destination for nature enthusiasts in Hong Kong. Whether you're an avid hiker or simply looking to escape the city for a day, Tai Mo Shan is a hidden gem that will leave you in awe of Hong Kong's natural wonders.
It took about 1 hour Hiking up to the top from the closest parking lot. Amazing views along the route. A good morning hiking for everyone.
Highly overrated compared to other much less busy mountains and trails. Nevertheless, if you love being surrounded by obnoxious tourist 'hikers' whose goal is just to summit the highest peak, enjoy!

A mountain for everyone! For beginners the car road for young and old, bikers) and experienced hikers who want some adventure. Some of the off-trail trails were very fun. Just watch out for spider webs!

Its name is well deserved, Tai Mo Shan (foggy mountain). It rained a bit the day I went there, oh boy it sure was foggy. I’m not complaining cuz it’s an interesting experience, I doubt you can get this view anywhere else in Hong Kong. Pick a sunny day to go if you want a clear view.

Although it’s the highest point in HK, the road up there is not difficult. Saw many kids and cyclists too, I think it’s suitable for beginner. Beware of vehicles tho, a lot of people drive there.

Also quite pleasant to see some yellow and black cows just there chilling, eating grass. They seemed to keep walking upward, I wonder where their destination was. The peak maybe? I stopped at the facility with a hemispherical building, I don’t know if that’s the peak. Also have fun avoiding all the cow poop sitting on the road.

Would like to revisit on a beautiful day in Autumn.
An interesting little hill that’s given a lot of fun to the local community. You could see many ping pong tables, mah jok tables and gym or sport facilities set up here.
Beautiful
We

The site of the former Sham Shui Po Service Reservoir is a relic of great historical value! It's a pity that you can't visit at will. You must book a guided tour online to visit, which is very difficult. The guided tour is detailed and clear, and there is also time reserved for photography, which is commendable and recommended.
Although the scenery on the top of the mountain is not open, it is good for sports near the urban area.

Nice palce to visit,the water is clear ..although many rabbish around When we Go there  because of the typhoon mangkhut last time..
The main attraction is the sea Palace which u Can see an arch that form a years ago by the power of Nature..Its moderate hike ,bring enough water when u plan to Go hike there.

We hire a speedboat at Sai Kung Pier for an agreed-upon pick-up and drop-off time. It takes about 30 minutes to travel to Basalt Island by boat. You can request to be dropped off at the pebble beach on the northern side, closest to Sai Kung. Boats are also able to drop you off directly in front of the Sea Palace or the famous archway of Basalt Island. Amazing sea arch and sea caves, crystal clear water and hexagonal columns. Better make use of waterproof bag for your belongings.
I will give 5 stars on this trail really amazing and beautiful view.. i love the coasteering the very challenging moment..the rock formations is awesome..

Rent private boat. Good place for swimming and coastering. Beware of sea urchin around the area.  Lam Wan Kok Cave to Sea Palace be swimmed and done coastering style with good enough climbing and swimming skills. Follow IG hikeclimbhk for more photos.
Very beautiful island, beautiful views also need extra energy to reach the most amazing Spots.

result.formatted_address: Upper Shing Mun Reservoir, Lo Wai, Hong Kong
result.name: Upper Shing Mun Reservoir

reviews.text: The Money Revisor is a wonderful destination located near Tsuen Wan that offers an exceptional experience with nature. However, it's important to be cautious around the local wildlife, particularly the monkeys, who may become jealous if fed. Overall, it's a great place to visit if you're looking for a peaceful and serene natural environment.

Easy hiking trail around the upper reservoir.  About 10km without much elevation.
Access on minibus 82 from Tsuen Wan to Pineapple Dam.

10/10 would recommend. Its is so gorgeous it doesn't look like its in HK. Its very beginner friendly given you can walk paved walkway for 3 hours. Long wait on holidays to get on the van. Taxi is a better choice.
A very beautiful hiking trail in Hong Kong especially during the autumn and winter seasons! Some parts of this pretty reservoir looked like the lakes in Switzerland and Scotland!

If you are nature lover, this one is for you😍🥳

Amazing Shing Mun Reservoir😍🥰

How to get there?
Mtr TSUEN WAN, exit B1 and take 82 minibus to reach the place🎉☺️
You can be careful.of the (monkey🐒🐒🐒)

result.formatted_address: Inspiration Lake, Hong Kong Disneyland Resort, Hong Kong
result.name: Inspiration Lake

reviews.text: Lovely lake and outdoor, well maintained and clean for the most part.  Not much parking there unfortunately so you have to get there early, parking fee is $55 dollar an hour.  There's also no food/drink available other than the lonely 7-11 - so pack your picnic basket ahead of time.  The next closest parking is about 1.6 km away in the Disney hotel ($$$ flatrate), the number 1 and 2 shuttle bus will NOT stop by the lake from the Disney hotel.

A nice place for picnic.  There are large grassland surrounding the lake with well facilities including convenient stall (7-11) offering wide variety of food and beverage, clean toilets, boat and bike renting, etc.  I enjoy strolling along the lake in a peaceful atmosphere.

The place is quite peaceful for a picnic.
If you plan nothing much do, pack your picnic bags...don't forget to get some good food, a Matt and a tent... because nothing much you can get there apart from a 7-11...nothing at all.
The boats and cycles are just kept as a spectacle most of it is non-operational. Don't be surprised only to see a couple of boats in the lake.
Soak the sun and just nap if you can find a good spot away from the Disney metro running past the place.

This park is great place to relax and unwind.  It’s far from the city but a great spot to enjoy the nature and serenity.  It’s packed on weekends and the parking situation can be terrible with the limited parking space available hence recommend to come on weekdays.  There are paddle boats for rents but the lake is closed due to COVID.
There’s a 7-11 here meaning you don’t have to pack much if you decided to have a picnic in the area.  Besides this area is beautiful and it’s great for jogging and photo shooting (saw a few groups of people taking wedding and family photos during my visit).

Serene picnic spot overlooking a manmade lake.

We enjoyed our day out at inspiration lake as we got to experience a peaceful location to spend our Sunday afternoon.

How to reach ?
Take the MTR to Sunny Bay (Tung Chung Line) from their hop on the the mtr to Disney land.
Once you're at Disney you can take the bus R8 which drops you right outside the lake house.

Difficulty 2/5 stars; you’ll have to walk/climb up a stream to reach the pool.

The 15 meters high Bride’s Pool Waterfall is located in Shuen Wan Country Park. It is easily accessible from the main road, Bride’s Pool Road parking lot/gazebo. There are a few different ways to walk there but we went this way: descend from the main road via the staircase in the parking lot. As you walk down, you’ll pass by some picnic/BBQ areas. You’ll reach a split end. Take the left which will bring you to the Bride’s Pool (right, up the stairs to Mirror’s Pool with a 35 meter high waterfall). You’ll reach another split end, take the descend one and continue. You’ll reach an open space with a stream. If you want to reach the waterfall, you’ll have to walk/climb up the stones to reach to the upper stream. The stones are slippery at times covered with lichen. Reward yourself with a dip in the pool at the end of the walk. The water is quite clear, you can see some fishes and shrimps in the water.

One of beautiful waterfall located in Hong Kong. You can reach to this place from taking 20R mini bus from Tai Po Market MTR station. However, this bus only available 1.30 hr frequently. Alternative if you visit this place in Sunday or Public Holiday then you can take 275R bus from Tai Po Market station which is more convenient. Once you get the bus you can get off from bride’s pool road.
There is small trail you have to take to reach this place. Also there are two ways you can reach to the waterfall one is stating from Bride’s pool nature trail or Bride’s pool barbecue site. Once you take the trail then halfway through you have to exit from usual trail and take a down route to come to the bottom of the waterfall.
Once you reach to the bottom of waterfall the sceneries are fantastic and you can take beautiful pictures. But have to be careful when you reach to this place because some times rocks are slippery.
Once you complete watching waterfall then you can came back to trail and continue towards that and complete the round trail which is not more that 3 kms.
Overall well recommended this place if you are nature lover and visit Hong Kong for your vacation

I was lucky with the weather and spent a short bit pleasant time at this place.
It was a bit difficult to get there. From Tai Po Market railway station you need to catch the mini bus (20R on weekdays) which leaves once an hour. Some people weren’t lucky enough to get a seat so they had to wait for the next one. That happened to me on the way back so I almost waited 2 hours in the middle of nowhere…
To the trail: it’s a short roundtrip with quite steep stairs. You can hear the waterfall but you can’t really see the whole beauty. I met less than 10 people on the whole trip. But there were 3 guys at the bottom of the waterfall to take pictures and I could here them talking the whole time because of the echoes. I imagine it to be very annoying with even more people. I was looking for a quiet place in the nature.
You could spend more time in that area with other routes but it could take quite a long time to get there/back.

Gorgeous. We went on a holiday so bus 275R was running from Tai po market mtr (exit a3). I don’t think it runs on a normal weekday so you’ll have to find another way there. We got off at exactly brides pool stop and explored the waterfalls in the area. Then we hiked down towards Chung Kiu and then took the same bus back to Tai mei Tuk where my son tried to fly his kite on a beautiful windy day.

A mini cascade located at the Bride’s Pool Nature Trail near Plover Cove Reservoir in Tai Po. This river cascade is named in association with a sad country story. It’s quite easily accessible & suitable for families. There are barbecue & car park facilities nearby and hence families can enjoy other activities after a nice tracking exercise.

result.formatted_address: 屏 南 石 澗, Shuen Wan, Hong Kong
result.name: Ping Nam Stream

reviews.text: Easy to hike but be careful to hold carefully watch every step to go up..nice stream,many pool and little falls going up
Beautiful nature adventures is real the best hiking trail
Slightly challenging stream but good views along the way
It was very nice place, peaceful and stress free.
So beautiful. Refreshing after a short hike

result.formatted_address: 8 Waterfall Bay Rd, Waterfall Bay, Hong Kong
result.name: Waterfall Bay Park

reviews.text: Located at the heart of Wah Fu, it has the best view from the south of Hong Kong. Best place for a stroll after dinner.

A large and magnificent waterfall close to a public housing estate which according to legend may have given Hong Kong its name. It is quite undervisited and relatively hidden but it is impressive nonetheless and the unspoiled natural beauty makes it a great hike destination. There is also a great view out towards the sea which makes this a great photo spot.
Nice to know there's waterfalls in hong Kong. Interesting place. Can go to other places nearby

It's a vertical fall with fresh water flowing to sea directly. There is small beach and pond forming a miniature landscape, get yourself a panoramic view of transoceanic vessels carrying piles of containers. This is one scenic spot along the Island South Trail which is a scenic route from Pokfulam to Stanley, get yourself a walk!
Nice place. However it's locked now. Close to Wah Fu estate and bus stop. Bus 73, 905 from cyber port and 4,4X from central.

I have been to this waterfall for several times and sometimes the fall could be very dry due to the lack of water. There are several tiers of pool under the waterfall and you can see people climbing up and down to get closer to the waterfall. There is pavilion and seating area close to the waterfall. Although I prefer to sit by the water.
Beautiful place. If you are a nature lover this place is perfect for you. Specially you can see some local buffaloes and cow on this place❤️one of my favourite place in Hongkong.

Famous beautiful waterfalls in Mui Wo, Lantau. I love the sceneries on my way to the waterfalls, also the atmosphere. I got to see the Silvermine Cave, it's just 4 minutes walk uphill from Silvermine Waterfall. Nice place to visit and a lot more to see at Mui Wo.

The waterfall is a great escape from the path. Depending on how much rain there had been it can be a trickle or a roaring fall. The rocks and boulders around it are big enough to walk and climb all over. There are bbq pits on site. It's a great place for kids, families, or a break all to yourself.

HONEST REVIEW.
The hike is a good exercise. Plenty of fresh air, nature sounds, few temples along the way and villages to see. The falls, well at this time they are semi dry. And really nothing that blew my breath away. Now if you enjoy a good hike, and want to get that heart and blood pumping, wear some comfy clothing and go for it. This place is not wheelchair accessible.
BRING WATER OR ANY BEVERAGE AND SNACKS. AFTER A CERTAIN POINT YOU WILL NEED IT. THERE AREN'T ANY STORES ONCE YOU START THE HIKE.

Climbing/hiking & hopping are fun in the rain but don't copy us. In fact, it is super danger coz rocks are slippery and could be flooding in the stream.

How to go? When you reach Sai Kung city, take a  taxi to Sai Wan pavilion for 30 minutes. Then walk pass by a public toilet. The entrance is under a tree.  You could go diving and swimming in pool. The whole trip takes 4 hours to complete.
Hike with my friend joan a little bit hot that time prefer to go early bring water a lot & sunblock. Its cool place lots of people during weekends. Its a hike , beach ,& stream
Im inlove in this place ,such a beautiful nature ,so blue clear water,white sand and so huge beach.There's falls too which you can do  cliff jumping.Would highly recommend here.

Amazing. We spent a week in HK and this hike was the highlight of the trip. Take a bus/taxi to the sai wan pavilion and follow the trails out.  Uber is not allowed enter the park. A taxi will take you the rest of the way (of coming by uber). The views are amazing and there is some great cliff diving  spots at the stream. Food and beverage choices on the beach are pricey, limited and low quality BUT given their location they can charge a premium.  We went in a group of 5 and spent about $10 a person on transportation after the day was over. Definitely worth it!
Nice fall for a little hike. You can do cliff diving here. The Only downside is transportation, be sure to check the schedule for shuttle or the boat ride back to Sao Kung.

one of the most beautiful places in HK. great for kids and family. good balance between a little bit of hiking with challenges, and nice water hole for kids to play with. definitely need hiking shoes.

The Ng Tung Chai Trail in the Tai Mo Shan Country Park is one of the most challenging and rewarding waterfall treks in Hong Kong. This is an approximately a 6km circular trail that starts in the Ng Tung Chai village on the northern boundary of the country park that passes by 4 highlight and signposted waterfalls before circling back to the village.

The trail passes a monastery before starting a steep climb up the mountain range, through thick and dense forest. The trail that winds through the trees, beside the main stream, at times zig-zagging alongside the side of the mountain. It is a challenging but beautiful trail that feels much more like something you'd find in Thailand or Hawaii than here in Hong Kong. The trail is mostly shaded with relatively little time exposed to the sun.

There are four waterfalls along the trail. You'll encounter posted signs just as you encounter them. Each includes boulders for you to sit, rest and enjoy. They are all photogenic and very nice. However, we like the first two falls for photo taking. There is a resting bench on a viewing platform at the #3 Main Falls. A fifth falls, called Yuk Nui Falls, is a short 5 minute side trail south of Scatter Falls (#4), it is really nice and potentially worth making a bit of extra time to see if you are enjoying your hike and not too tired at this stage.

After seeing the four (or five) waterfalls, you then begin to wind your way back down the range until your reach the starting point back at the Ng Tung Chai Village. Alternatively, some like to combine this trail with Tai Mo Shan (highest peak in HK). After passing the falls, before the trail circles back north, there is an intersection where you can switch over to a trail making way to Tai Mo Shan.

Note: There are no facilities along the trail so you may want to use the public toilet at the village before setting off on your hike. Do bring plenty of drinking water as well and some snacks as well.

Note: To make your way to the Ng Tung Chai village where you begin the hike, you can take public bus 64K between Tai Po and Yuen Long and disembark on the main road at the Ng Tung Chai bus stop. Alternatively, if you take a taxi, they will drive into the village and drop you off just near the public toilets and trail starting point.

The most beautiful place in Hing Kong. The trail is crowned with four spectacular waterfall. Each and every stage of the trail is surreal, unfathomable, gorgeous. Very safe, huge place yet thrilling. I am sure during rain this place would be more pristine.
Go and hike and fell in love with this place forever ❤️

Absolutely beautiful! A series of 4 beautiful waterfalls in Tai Mo Shan country park. It’s a moderately challenging hike to go from the base of the mountain to see all 4 waterfalls and back. Some parts of it can be very steep and narrow so prepare accordingly. Pack a sandwich with you to enjoy your lunch after the hike near one of the waterfalls. My personal favorite was the middle fall (2nd in the series).

Ng Tung Chai Cascade
On the 23rd June 2022 this group of Waterfalls were visited.
A KMB 64K bus took me from Tai Po Market Train Station to here within half an hour.
I alighted the bus at the junction of Lam Kam Road and Ng Tung Chai Road
The beginning of the walk was on paved ground but after about 600M , it became  sand and mud trail. Continue for about 2.4 Km using 3 hours , the three (lower stream, Bottom Fall, Middle Fall) Waterfalls were visited ,the highest for me was the Middle fall. The Main Fall was missed. All the 4 waterfalls were within the elevation of 300 m- to 400 m Region. The walk was strenuous as it was steep, with gravel stones of irregular heights. The strong spectacular cascade was the Middle Fall.
It was worth the visit because the waterfalls sights and sound  were mesmerizing.
It would be better to visit in Autumn. The down Hill walk was fast , only took 50 minutes.
Written on June 28th 2022

editorial_summary.overview: Uninhabited until 1962, this landmark island features a drug treatment & rehabilitation center.

reviews.text: wow
Only saw the island from a boat.
Restricted Island
Do your bit for the environment
My house. Fishing home ground

editorial_summary.overview: Leisure area with an artificial lake, boat rentals & walking trails, plus scenic city views.

ChIJG3qKtcsBBDQR3YsQt1J9KOs.formatted_address: Wong Nai Chung Gap, Hong Kong
ChIJG3qKtcsBBDQR3YsQt1J9KOs.name: Wong Nai Chung Reservoir Park

reviews.text: It's a nice spot to have a family outing. It provides the park with water sports, snacks shop and toilet. It also connects to a walking track.
Nice trail for the locals to walk around, but it is not a trail for the tourists.  The reserve looks nice but a bit small.  Not much scenery there, only a relaxing walk.
Pretty. Relaxing place to bring the kids, close to public transport. Paddle boats are available for hire.

The Wong Nai Chung Reservoir was the third man made lake constructed in Hong Kong back in 1899 and can be found just off the Wong Nai Chung Gap Road on Hong Kong Island. It is a small reservoir only holding around 27 million gallons, which led to the further damming of the nearby Tai Tam Valley to create a series of additional lakes in the decades that followed its construction.

There is a small park that opened to the public in 1986 immediately around the lake which includes a recreation centre where you can hire leisure boats to enjoy on the lake (closed presently due to the pandemic). There is a kiosk for refreshments and public toilets as well. Another point of interest are the four Declared Monuments that can be viewed at Wong Nai Chung Reservoir. These include the reservoir dam, weir, value house and workman's quarters building just west of the lake.

In the end, a visit to the Wong Nai Chung Reservoir and Park is best combined with a visit to the much larger and interesting series of reservoirs, trails and declared monuments that make up the Tai Tam Heritage Trail in the Tai Tam Country Park to the east of here. You can visit Wong Nai Chung first at the start of the hike and day in the country park before proceeding east on foot to Tai Tam.

Note: From the city, take bus 6 between Central and Stanley. Exit at Wong Nai Chung Gap Road which you will see on the announcement sign in the bus. The exit is at a Sinopec petrol station. Walk up a small staircase to the Tai Tam Reservoir Road and walk to your left 150 metres or so and you will arrive at the Wong Nai Chung Reservoir Park. There are signs along the way and onward to the Tai Tam Reservoirs, Country Park and Heritage Trail as well.
Wonderful first solo trail run for me. Also a great hike if your not into running

editorial_summary.overview: Valley parkland with farm animals, horseback rides & strawberry picking amid lychee forests.

ChIJm2tPmjj6AzQRRQWMs9fU0Sw.formatted_address: 11 Tai Tong Shan Rd, Yuen Long, Hong Kong
ChIJm2tPmjj6AzQRRQWMs9fU0Sw.name: Tai Tong Organic EcoPark

reviews.text:
Kids enjoy it but from a educational, ecological and financial point of view it is a disaster start to finish.

There is nothing organic or ecological there with the exception of plenty of mosquitoes. Massive use of plastic, single use items starting from the feeding trays to the artificial green grass used as an outdoor sliding area.

The state of the animal farm is sad and reflects a 1950 understanding of animal welfare. The all concrete and metal enclaves for most animals with little space and greenery makes is a case for how not to treat animals. In most developed nations this would have been closed down long time ago.

Financially it is squeezing out money at every attraction. So make sure you either buy a few tickets at the park entrance (and they come in bulk of four tickets but it’s a better deal than buying it one by one inside the park) or just stroll through and try resist your kids forcing you to buy attraction tickets.

The overall state of the park is frankly speaking bad. The seating areas are dirty, chairs broken, toilets small and smelly, no soap or hand towels in the bathrooms, the playground worn out, trash almost everywhere…

I had fun, the food at the restaurant is great, their soy sauce chicken is a bomb! Lot of things to do especially with the kids, there are different kinds of animals that you can feed, but you have to buy ticket for Thier food, the entrance fee is 80dollars adult.

It's good for kids with some live animals like pig, horse, goat, rabbits, guinea pigs and birds like peacock, white and regular ones, pea hens,  fowl, turkey etc. However the animal enclosures are very smelly due to their urine and poop in enclosures .
The main or star activity for kids is the horse ride which is good👍 . Those horses are quite well maintained and don't smell. Bouncy castle, family bi cycling, funny climbing net is also good and kids enjoy a lot. At least 3  to 4 hours is needed inside the park excluding travel time.
Lotus pond is amazing with fish feeding activity for all.

What a dump! Dirty and rude staff. So many hazard risks in kids play area, very unsafe. Animals don’t appear to be in the best of health. Once you pay the entrance fee you need to pay for everything inside. Most attractions require a few tickets per child so it ends up being a very expensive day for such a disappointing venue. They have limited food options and all low quality. Hot food was served cold. Rubbish everywhere and staff don’t seem to care. They yell and have no manners. It’s simply a money making business with no regard for the environment. Single use plastic cups are used for animal feed and it was sad to see them thrown around the place. Don’t understand how they are still open for business. Nothing eco friendly about this farm.

A large park. You pay an entry fee and you get some coupons which you can use for activities. Apart from the playgrounds anything needs to be paid / needs coupons. There are some nice kids activities like carts or sliding down the hill, house ride (2 coupons for 30sec in a circle!), etc.
Note, there are quite some insects, the small ones you almost don't see, but which bite. So, don't forget insect spray even it might help completely.
Some food can be purchased inside the park, but you can also bring your own food.

editorial_summary.overview: Destination for open-air swimming in the ocean offering a wooden pier with steps down to the water.

ChIJQ5KSs73_AzQR0CcIDflVcAo.formatted_address: Victoria Rd, Mount Davis, Hong Kong
ChIJQ5KSs73_AzQR0CcIDflVcAo.name: Sai Wan Swimming Shed

reviews.text: Nice sunset view & cool environment. With 2/3 houses of fisher men who enjoy swimming there. Note when you go during summer time always remember to take insect repellent & long sleeves clothes.
Prepare for a mini sweat walk from the station and up the slopes and down the stairs. Nice chill spot. Great for a late afternoon visit.
Low key touristic place but very well hidden and not many people go here. The local amenities are a cute sight as well as the swimming area itself (currently locked off). Lots to discover.
a quiet and tranquil swimming spot at the edge of Hong Kong island, however people need to consider their own swimming ability and saftey before going down for a swim

Very cool place to get in the water ... Note the boat traffic doesn't really allow open water swimming here .
I run all the way from Sheung Wan .
It's a serious climb in the end . Note steps are slippery up and down.

editorial_summary.overview: Quiet, secluded park & gardens popular for photos, picnics & panoramic views of the city.

ChIJQ73aHHYABDQR5twO0q4bzM4.formatted_address: Mount Austin Rd, The Peak, Hong Kong
ChIJQ73aHHYABDQR5twO0q4bzM4.name: Victoria Peak Garden

reviews.text: If you can make it to the top to this garden then you'd be greeted with rewarding views.  I think without a car I would not have reached this peak garden, certainly didn't even know about it in the past when I was a normal tourist on foot.  Today it was cloudy at the peak and probably for the first time I stood in the clouds as it swept past me.  Well worth the struggle up to if you can make it.

It s 20min walk to go up (but not fast walking).
You will find quite a small garden however the view is amazing there.
There is not too much people.

The Victoria peak garden can be directly accessible by car (there is a parking)

It’s not HK
Very peaceful and nice
The washroom is like a smaller villa
I’m sure this the khs most expensive washroom 🤪

Prepare yourself for a long line during night visit.

Best view at night
Make sure to be there before 8 to witness symphony of light
Awesome place to view the city from. Beautiful mountains with skyscrapers in the background! Also felt very safe at night

Interesting rocks, nice view!!!
Indeed, wonders of nature are amazing!
Be careful and be aware of the path, there are tombs everywhere but cannot notice easily. Better to give respect than to disregard it.
Beautiful place..

Definitely one of the most beautiful hiking area in town which is accessible and can be finished quickly (though not easy level with the steep hillside)
The view here is just astonishing
It's a good place for hike and climbing too, first we have to descend from mount Johnston to go to Ap lei Pai. Don't forget bring the gloves.

A great place for hikers and lovers of nature.. if you like coastal hiking on rocks,  i love to tell you try this place... wonderful! But please prepare hand gloves coz you are climbing on rocks... 🏔🏞⛰💪🙏👌💕
Short Climbing  hikes wz excellent scenaries of coastlines and  buildings on other side. beautiful lighthouse. 💖💖💖

Love this place....🥰
But  swimming not allowed...in this area...

Beautiful hike from Hong Kong trail 4 to 5. The waterfall is a fantastic place to have a picnic and there is a large pool where you can cool off. You are at the top of the fall and you can't see the water falling down but there is a constant stream of water rushing down creating little pools of water. I decided to take off my socks and shoes and dunked them into one of the said pools. Iwas bliss. What was missing was a cool bottle of beer. Water was not too hot or too cold but at the perfect temperature. No need for a towel as the sun dried off my feet in minutes.

As I was leaving another 2 groups came along and it looked like they were going to take a well deserved dip into the main big pool as they began to strip off. See pic.

Need to remember to bring a couple of cans for next time.

This is a busy route as there is gorgeous reservoirs with large koi carp in and one with a fountain. So getting back can be a pain as the bus is only every 30 mins and it's packed.

Beautiful waterfall, though you're not allowed to swim in the pool directly below the waterfall itself (two workmen appeared while I was there to chase people out who were swimming there).

I don't know why you're not allowed to swim in that part because about 30 metres down steam there is another, smaller and less deep pool you are allowed to swim in!

You can also relax on the rocks directly above the waterfall. Overall this is a nice place for a picnic. I didn't see any mosquitoes and the trees provide welcome shade from the sun. And it's only a 20 minute walk from the bus stop!

Everything you need is to seach in google if you want to find this place or ask the local how to get here bcs the falls beauty is hiding ..not recommended for children under 8y/o(my own opinion)bcs the way down to the falls is rocky,and slippery (small sharp rocks) so be carefull when you want to there ..
Nice hidden tiny waterfall, but PLEASE DO NOT SWIM THERE. The water flows into the Tai Tam Reservoir.

editorial_summary.overview: Small island known for sheer cliffs & oceanfront scenery viewed from adjacent hiking trails.

reviews.text:
Po Pin Chau is formed by hexagonal volcano stone. To me I only saw similar formation in Iceland.

Starting the walk from the blue memorial stone at the East dam of High Island Reservoir to Po Pin Chau, you can see a very beautiful scenery of the Reservoir construction as well as the open sea view.

Take a green taxi from Sai Kung town center. You arrive at the East dam about 20 to 25 minutes. Along the road, you may see a large number of cows walking slowly or maybe they will block your way temporarily.

The taxi fare is about $140. You may choose 4 seat or 5 seat taxi dependent on the number of passengers. To ease your coming back, it is better to ask for the telephone number of the taxi call center.

You may take photos at the blue memorial stone and go to wash room before starting the trail. Not far away from the toilet booth, you may see the starting point, a stairs, to Po Pin Chau. Counting on taking photos along the trail, you may spend about 1 or 1.5 hours to Po Pin Chau.

Upon return, you will go to the end of the Dam and wait for a taxi. When arriving at Sai Kung town center, do not forget to try seafood.

It is really not a difficult walk to get to Po Pin Chau. Bring your walking stick and the steps are relatively well maintained.  A great way to enjoy the surrounding.

Make sure you bring enough water as there is no supplies here.
Amazing views and stunning rock formation ❤❤❤🥰
Nice nature landscape. Non experience  hikers neglect of risk to climb.

amazing rock formation...
nice for viewing but to get there is hard to step...up & down on the mountain

editorial_summary.overview: Island & popular dive site made up of sedimentary rocks, with rock pools, cliffs & temples.

reviews.text:
Fascinating little Island has a lot going for it.

Based in a Marine Park, the Island is also a UNESCO Geo Park (cool rocks to be found) and is the most North Eastern area of Hong Kong.

The water is clear with quite a few nice swimming spots to be found. Just remember to take your trash with you as the few people living on the Island would certainly appreciate it.

Hiking around the Island is more like a stroll and it's actually an extension of the Plover Cove Country Park for those keeping track.

Worth a visit to see a remote and almost forgotten Island of HK.

Wonderful little island part of HK.

To get there, I recommend being at the ferry pier at least 30m before departure as the queue can be very long. At the end of the queue, you will be able to buy toundtrip tickets for Tung Ping Chau. Don't worry if the queue seems long, in case there is a lot of people queuing the ferry company will send multiple boats.

Once on the island, there is pretty much nothing to buy, so come prepared with water and food. There are some spots (right of the arrival pier) where you can have a swim without rocks, so bring your swimsuit :)

The Tung Ping Chau trail is around 6.5 km in distance and circles the outlying island of Tung Ping Chau. It is a fairly easy hike which is a mix of paved walkway and quick a bit of natural trail. It takes around 3-4 hours to complete with minimal stops or up to 5-6 hours if you take in the numerous geological points of interest and viewpoints along the route. Plenty of signs, maps and highlight information panels found throughout the trail.

Note: There is a shorter version of the trail that skips the far north of the island cutting across the island at Cham Keng Chau on the west coast back across to the main ferry pier.

Note: To make your way to Tung Ping Chau for this particular hike, you will need to visit on the weekend and take the ferry from Ma Liu Shui Pier, 10 minute walk from University MTR Station. Sailings on only on Saturday (9am and 3pm) and Sunday (9am) and is around 1.5 hours to travel the 27km distance to Tung Ping Chau. The ferry returns from Tung Ping Chau to Ma Liu Shui Pier at 5.15pm (Sat and Sun). There are no daily sailings to Tung Ping Chau during weekdays.

The Tung Ping Chau Trail passes through several abandoned villages with ruinous hamlets and a handful of highlight geological sites where you can view, walk upon and admire unique sedimentary rock formations that protrude from the Earth at various angles and form beautiful coastal scenes alongside the clean blue waters that surround the island. There are nice beachfronts, stretches of hillside with heavy vegetation, wooded areas and even patches of bamboo forrest that you will see.

Particular highlights along the Tung Ping Chau Trail include A Ma Wan Beach, the Tin Hau Temple and Kang Lau Shek where you see impressive sea stacks and Wave-cut sedimentary patterns. Lung Lok Shui, Pak Lap Wan and Chau Wei Kok have similar wave-cut patterns and rock formations. There is a neat sea abrasion canyon you can walk through at Cam Keng Chau as well.

There are picnic areas and several public toilet facilities situated on the east side of the island trail. A small village area just a few hundred metres from the main pier includes a couple of island cafes where you will also find toilets. This is a good location for a rest break and bite to eat if you fancy something while waiting for the 5.15pm afternoon ferry off of Tung Ping Chau.

Overall, this trail offers a great full day out of the city, particularly when the weather is clear and favourable. The hike is quite easy and the scenery is very rewarding. There are a surprising number of other hikers and day trippers that you will see throughout the day but they tend to spread around the island so it isn't too difficult to find quiet spots if you look for them. The biggest issue with this particular trail is that it is limited to weekend use due to the lack of weekday ferries out to Tung Ping Chau.

Quite remote from HK, but definitely worth it! The island has amazing geological features, super cool to see and unique in HK due to its remote location. A good idea is to walk around the island, in 2 or 3 hours.

Fantastic forgotten island of Hong Kong. Once 3000 people lived here and now down to 10 or so. The ferry goes from Ma Lui Shui pier, get there early because it’s busy. We got there 30 mins early and only just got on the first boat. Once there, there are a few eating places open at weekends, the whole island takes 3-4 hours taking it very slowly and exploring the empty houses and villages. Well worth checking out the houses. Some very pretty beaches and outstanding geological features. Would be fun to camp out a night here.
It's fun to go see the caves.
Love the views around...
Pineapple Mountain (Por Lo Shan) never failed to amaze me with its incredible scenery and its colour is like a similarity to pineapple fruit 🍍.
The Chinese name of this place，菠蘿山，Por Lo Shan, means Pineapple Mountain.  It is on the west of Tuen Mun and is a popular hiking area with several miles of hiking trails.
I have no Idea what happened, I followed the directions and it took me to a cemetery… Now I’m a white guy disturbing the peace of people’s mourning. Fix it please. Thats just horrible
One of the mini mountain which located at the Tuen Mun city. Good for hiking even with kids.

editorial_summary.overview: Hong Kong's highest point at 3,140 feet in a country park with a visitor center & observatory.

reviews.text:
Tai Mo Shan is the highest peak in Hong Kong, and it offers a truly remarkable experience for nature lovers and outdoor enthusiasts. I recently had the opportunity to visit Tai Mo Shan, and I was blown away by its beauty and tranquility.

The journey to Tai Mo Shan was an adventure in itself. The winding roads and lush greenery along the way created a sense of anticipation and excitement. Upon reaching the peak, I was greeted with breathtaking panoramic views of the surrounding landscape. The sight of rolling hills, dense forests, and the city skyline in the distance was simply awe-inspiring.

Another notable feature of Tai Mo Shan is its unique ecosystem. The mountain is home to a diverse range of flora and fauna, including rare species of plants and animals. It was a delight to spot colorful butterflies, hear the melodious songs of birds, and witness the vibrant blooms of wildflowers along the trails.

Overall, my visit to Tai Mo Shan was a truly memorable experience. The stunning views, peaceful atmosphere, and well-maintained facilities make it a must-visit destination for nature enthusiasts in Hong Kong. Whether you're an avid hiker or simply looking to escape the city for a day, Tai Mo Shan is a hidden gem that will leave you in awe of Hong Kong's natural wonders.
It took about 1 hour Hiking up to the top from the closest parking lot. Amazing views along the route. A good morning hiking for everyone.
Highly overrated compared to other much less busy mountains and trails. Nevertheless, if you love being surrounded by obnoxious tourist 'hikers' whose goal is just to summit the highest peak, enjoy!

A mountain for everyone! For beginners the car road for young and old, bikers) and experienced hikers who want some adventure. Some of the off-trail trails were very fun. Just watch out for spider webs!

Its name is well deserved, Tai Mo Shan (foggy mountain). It rained a bit the day I went there, oh boy it sure was foggy. I’m not complaining cuz it’s an interesting experience, I doubt you can get this view anywhere else in Hong Kong. Pick a sunny day to go if you want a clear view.

Although it’s the highest point in HK, the road up there is not difficult. Saw many kids and cyclists too, I think it’s suitable for beginner. Beware of vehicles tho, a lot of people drive there.

Also quite pleasant to see some yellow and black cows just there chilling, eating grass. They seemed to keep walking upward, I wonder where their destination was. The peak maybe? I stopped at the facility with a hemispherical building, I don’t know if that’s the peak. Also have fun avoiding all the cow poop sitting on the road.

Would like to revisit on a beautiful day in Autumn.

editorial_summary.overview: Urban park with exercise equipment & ping pong tables, plus shady hilltop trails & city views.

reviews.text: An interesting little hill that’s given a lot of fun to the local community. You could see many ping pong tables, mah jok tables and gym or sport facilities set up here.
Beautiful
We

The site of the former Sham Shui Po Service Reservoir is a relic of great historical value! It's a pity that you can't visit at will. You must book a guided tour online to visit, which is very difficult. The guided tour is detailed and clear, and there is also time reserved for photography, which is commendable and recommended.
Although the scenery on the top of the mountain is not open, it is good for sports near the urban area.

Nice palce to visit,the water is clear ..although many rabbish around When we Go there  because of the typhoon mangkhut last time..
The main attraction is the sea Palace which u Can see an arch that form a years ago by the power of Nature..Its moderate hike ,bring enough water when u plan to Go hike there.

We hire a speedboat at Sai Kung Pier for an agreed-upon pick-up and drop-off time. It takes about 30 minutes to travel to Basalt Island by boat. You can request to be dropped off at the pebble beach on the northern side, closest to Sai Kung. Boats are also able to drop you off directly in front of the Sea Palace or the famous archway of Basalt Island. Amazing sea arch and sea caves, crystal clear water and hexagonal columns. Better make use of waterproof bag for your belongings.
I will give 5 stars on this trail really amazing and beautiful view.. i love the coasteering the very challenging moment..the rock formations is awesome..

Rent private boat. Good place for swimming and coastering. Beware of sea urchin around the area.  Lam Wan Kok Cave to Sea Palace be swimmed and done coastering style with good enough climbing and swimming skills. Follow IG hikeclimbhk for more photos.
Very beautiful island, beautiful views also need extra energy to reach the most amazing Spots.

editorial_summary.overview: Water reservoir made in 1937, surrounded by wooded country park with trails & rich wildlife.

ChIJH9xLi4YHBDQR4vPejuQssdA.formatted_address: Upper Shing Mun Reservoir, Lo Wai, Hong Kong
ChIJH9xLi4YHBDQR4vPejuQssdA.name: Upper Shing Mun Reservoir

reviews.text: The Money Revisor is a wonderful destination located near Tsuen Wan that offers an exceptional experience with nature. However, it's important to be cautious around the local wildlife, particularly the monkeys, who may become jealous if fed. Overall, it's a great place to visit if you're looking for a peaceful and serene natural environment.

Easy hiking trail around the upper reservoir.  About 10km without much elevation.
Access on minibus 82 from Tsuen Wan to Pineapple Dam.

10/10 would recommend. Its is so gorgeous it doesn't look like its in HK. Its very beginner friendly given you can walk paved walkway for 3 hours. Long wait on holidays to get on the van. Taxi is a better choice.
A very beautiful hiking trail in Hong Kong especially during the autumn and winter seasons! Some parts of this pretty reservoir looked like the lakes in Switzerland and Scotland!

If you are nature lover, this one is for you😍🥳

Amazing Shing Mun Reservoir😍🥰

How to get there?
Mtr TSUEN WAN, exit B1 and take 82 minibus to reach the place🎉☺️
You can be careful.of the (monkey🐒🐒🐒)

editorial_summary.overview: Artificial recreation lake with jogging trail, arboretum, playground & fountain in Disneyland Park.

ChIJK8HpzyT8AzQReHcq1wu_DCM.formatted_address: Inspiration Lake, Hong Kong Disneyland Resort, Hong Kong
ChIJK8HpzyT8AzQReHcq1wu_DCM.name: Inspiration Lake

reviews.text: Lovely lake and outdoor, well maintained and clean for the most part.  Not much parking there unfortunately so you have to get there early, parking fee is $55 dollar an hour.  There's also no food/drink available other than the lonely 7-11 - so pack your picnic basket ahead of time.  The next closest parking is about 1.6 km away in the Disney hotel ($$$ flatrate), the number 1 and 2 shuttle bus will NOT stop by the lake from the Disney hotel.

A nice place for picnic.  There are large grassland surrounding the lake with well facilities including convenient stall (7-11) offering wide variety of food and beverage, clean toilets, boat and bike renting, etc.  I enjoy strolling along the lake in a peaceful atmosphere.

The place is quite peaceful for a picnic.
If you plan nothing much do, pack your picnic bags...don't forget to get some good food, a Matt and a tent... because nothing much you can get there apart from a 7-11...nothing at all.
The boats and cycles are just kept as a spectacle most of it is non-operational. Don't be surprised only to see a couple of boats in the lake.
Soak the sun and just nap if you can find a good spot away from the Disney metro running past the place.

This park is great place to relax and unwind.  It’s far from the city but a great spot to enjoy the nature and serenity.  It’s packed on weekends and the parking situation can be terrible with the limited parking space available hence recommend to come on weekdays.  There are paddle boats for rents but the lake is closed due to COVID.
There’s a 7-11 here meaning you don’t have to pack much if you decided to have a picnic in the area.  Besides this area is beautiful and it’s great for jogging and photo shooting (saw a few groups of people taking wedding and family photos during my visit).

Serene picnic spot overlooking a manmade lake.

We enjoyed our day out at inspiration lake as we got to experience a peaceful location to spend our Sunday afternoon.

How to reach ?
Take the MTR to Sunny Bay (Tung Chung Line) from their hop on the the mtr to Disney land.
Once you're at Disney you can take the bus R8 which drops you right outside the lake house.

editorial_summary.overview: Tranquil locale featuring a waterfall cascading into a cool pool, with lush trails & picnic areas.

ChIJucspxQAMBDQR1P_NJRG89P4.formatted_address: Bride's Pool, Shuen Wan, Hong Kong
ChIJucspxQAMBDQR1P_NJRG89P4.name: Bride's Pool

reviews.text: Some people says it has 3 Water Falls , only to found out today that it has only Mirror Pool and Brides Pool . But we enjoyed it coz we discovered the Chung Mei Dam and it has beautiful white stones formations aside from Water Falls in Brides Pool area.
An attraction when you hike along Wu Kau Tang.
Stunning, natural and peaceful walk or hike around this area. Glad that I made it back.
Trails suitable for families, BBQ areas at multiple levels, and well signposted.
Eventhough not much water but still it's beautiful

ChIJqQJUEtsLBDQR57esbT6fRMA.formatted_address: 屏 南 石 澗, Shuen Wan, Hong Kong
ChIJqQJUEtsLBDQR57esbT6fRMA.name: Ping Nam Stream

reviews.text: Easy to hike but be careful to hold carefully watch every step to go up..nice stream,many pool and little falls going up
Beautiful nature adventures is real the best hiking trail
Slightly challenging stream but good views along the way
It was very nice place, peaceful and stress free.
So beautiful. Refreshing after a short hike

editorial_summary.overview: Bayside park area featuring a scenic waterfall, plus a pedestrian path, picnic tables & grills.

ChIJi1dvV_z_AzQRmRFl_mBqy5Y.formatted_address: 8 Waterfall Bay Rd, Waterfall Bay, Hong Kong
ChIJi1dvV_z_AzQRmRFl_mBqy5Y.name: Waterfall Bay Park

reviews.text: Located at the heart of Wah Fu, it has the best view from the south of Hong Kong. Best place for a stroll after dinner.

A large and magnificent waterfall close to a public housing estate which according to legend may have given Hong Kong its name. It is quite undervisited and relatively hidden but it is impressive nonetheless and the unspoiled natural beauty makes it a great hike destination. There is also a great view out towards the sea which makes this a great photo spot.
Nice to know there's waterfalls in hong Kong. Interesting place. Can go to other places nearby

It's a vertical fall with fresh water flowing to sea directly. There is small beach and pond forming a miniature landscape, get yourself a panoramic view of transoceanic vessels carrying piles of containers. This is one scenic spot along the Island South Trail which is a scenic route from Pokfulam to Stanley, get yourself a walk!
Nice place. However it's locked now. Close to Wah Fu estate and bus stop. Bus 73, 905 from cyber port and 4,4X from central.

I have been to this waterfall for several times and sometimes the fall could be very dry due to the lack of water. There are several tiers of pool under the waterfall and you can see people climbing up and down to get closer to the waterfall. There is pavilion and seating area close to the waterfall. Although I prefer to sit by the water.
Beautiful place. If you are a nature lover this place is perfect for you. Specially you can see some local buffaloes and cow on this place❤️one of my favourite place in Hongkong.

Famous beautiful waterfalls in Mui Wo, Lantau. I love the sceneries on my way to the waterfalls, also the atmosphere. I got to see the Silvermine Cave, it's just 4 minutes walk uphill from Silvermine Waterfall. Nice place to visit and a lot more to see at Mui Wo.

The waterfall is a great escape from the path. Depending on how much rain there had been it can be a trickle or a roaring fall. The rocks and boulders around it are big enough to walk and climb all over. There are bbq pits on site. It's a great place for kids, families, or a break all to yourself.

HONEST REVIEW.
The hike is a good exercise. Plenty of fresh air, nature sounds, few temples along the way and villages to see. The falls, well at this time they are semi dry. And really nothing that blew my breath away. Now if you enjoy a good hike, and want to get that heart and blood pumping, wear some comfy clothing and go for it. This place is not wheelchair accessible.
BRING WATER OR ANY BEVERAGE AND SNACKS. AFTER A CERTAIN POINT YOU WILL NEED IT. THERE AREN'T ANY STORES ONCE YOU START THE HIKE.

Climbing/hiking & hopping are fun in the rain but don't copy us. In fact, it is super danger coz rocks are slippery and could be flooding in the stream.

How to go? When you reach Sai Kung city, take a  taxi to Sai Wan pavilion for 30 minutes. Then walk pass by a public toilet. The entrance is under a tree.  You could go diving and swimming in pool. The whole trip takes 4 hours to complete.
Hike with my friend joan a little bit hot that time prefer to go early bring water a lot & sunblock. Its cool place lots of people during weekends. Its a hike , beach ,& stream
Im inlove in this place ,such a beautiful nature ,so blue clear water,white sand and so huge beach.There's falls too which you can do  cliff jumping.Would highly recommend here.

Amazing. We spent a week in HK and this hike was the highlight of the trip. Take a bus/taxi to the sai wan pavilion and follow the trails out.  Uber is not allowed enter the park. A taxi will take you the rest of the way (of coming by uber). The views are amazing and there is some great cliff diving  spots at the stream. Food and beverage choices on the beach are pricey, limited and low quality BUT given their location they can charge a premium.  We went in a group of 5 and spent about $10 a person on transportation after the day was over. Definitely worth it!
Nice fall for a little hike. You can do cliff diving here. The Only downside is transportation, be sure to check the schedule for shuttle or the boat ride back to Sao Kung.

editorial_summary.overview: A forest track leads to this series of 4 waterfalls with pools, some large enough for swimming.

reviews.text: one of the most beautiful places in HK. great for kids and family. good balance between a little bit of hiking with challenges, and nice water hole for kids to play with. definitely need hiking shoes.

The Ng Tung Chai Trail in the Tai Mo Shan Country Park is one of the most challenging and rewarding waterfall treks in Hong Kong. This is an approximately a 6km circular trail that starts in the Ng Tung Chai village on the northern boundary of the country park that passes by 4 highlight and signposted waterfalls before circling back to the village.

The trail passes a monastery before starting a steep climb up the mountain range, through thick and dense forest. The trail that winds through the trees, beside the main stream, at times zig-zagging alongside the side of the mountain. It is a challenging but beautiful trail that feels much more like something you'd find in Thailand or Hawaii than here in Hong Kong. The trail is mostly shaded with relatively little time exposed to the sun.

There are four waterfalls along the trail. You'll encounter posted signs just as you encounter them. Each includes boulders for you to sit, rest and enjoy. They are all photogenic and very nice. However, we like the first two falls for photo taking. There is a resting bench on a viewing platform at the #3 Main Falls. A fifth falls, called Yuk Nui Falls, is a short 5 minute side trail south of Scatter Falls (#4), it is really nice and potentially worth making a bit of extra time to see if you are enjoying your hike and not too tired at this stage.

After seeing the four (or five) waterfalls, you then begin to wind your way back down the range until your reach the starting point back at the Ng Tung Chai Village. Alternatively, some like to combine this trail with Tai Mo Shan (highest peak in HK). After passing the falls, before the trail circles back north, there is an intersection where you can switch over to a trail making way to Tai Mo Shan.

Note: There are no facilities along the trail so you may want to use the public toilet at the village before setting off on your hike. Do bring plenty of drinking water as well and some snacks as well.

Note: To make your way to the Ng Tung Chai village where you begin the hike, you can take public bus 64K between Tai Po and Yuen Long and disembark on the main road at the Ng Tung Chai bus stop. Alternatively, if you take a taxi, they will drive into the village and drop you off just near the public toilets and trail starting point.

The most beautiful place in Hing Kong. The trail is crowned with four spectacular waterfall. Each and every stage of the trail is surreal, unfathomable, gorgeous. Very safe, huge place yet thrilling. I am sure during rain this place would be more pristine.
Go and hike and fell in love with this place forever ❤️

Absolutely beautiful! A series of 4 beautiful waterfalls in Tai Mo Shan country park. It’s a moderately challenging hike to go from the base of the mountain to see all 4 waterfalls and back. Some parts of it can be very steep and narrow so prepare accordingly. Pack a sandwich with you to enjoy your lunch after the hike near one of the waterfalls. My personal favorite was the middle fall (2nd in the series).

Ng Tung Chai Cascade
On the 23rd June 2022 this group of Waterfalls were visited.
A KMB 64K bus took me from Tai Po Market Train Station to here within half an hour.
I alighted the bus at the junction of Lam Kam Road and Ng Tung Chai Road
The beginning of the walk was on paved ground but after about 600M , it became  sand and mud trail. Continue for about 2.4 Km using 3 hours , the three (lower stream, Bottom Fall, Middle Fall) Waterfalls were visited ,the highest for me was the Middle fall. The Main Fall was missed. All the 4 waterfalls were within the elevation of 300 m- to 400 m Region. The walk was strenuous as it was steep, with gravel stones of irregular heights. The strong spectacular cascade was the Middle Fall.
It was worth the visit because the waterfalls sights and sound  were mesmerizing.
It would be better to visit in Autumn. The down Hill walk was fast , only took 50 minutes.
Written on June 28th 2022
